channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Sterling Partner Engagement Manager
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Sterling Partner Engagement Manager

item.title: CVE-2023-43045|2024-08-02T19:37:23.431Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.1.2, 6.2.0, and 6.2.2 could allow a remote user to perform unauthorized actions due to improper authentication. IBM X-Force ID: 266896.

item.title: CVE-2023-38722|2024-08-02T17:46:56.599Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.1.2, 6.2.0, and 6.2.2 is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 262174.

item.title: CVE-2023-23480|2024-08-02T10:35:32.165Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.1, 6.2, and 6.2.1 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 245885.

item.title: CVE-2023-23481|2024-08-02T10:35:32.131Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.1, 6.2, and 6.2.1 is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 245889.

item.title: CVE-2023-23482|2024-08-02T10:35:32.195Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.1, 6.2, and 6.2.1 could allow a remote attacker to hijack the clicking action of the victim. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to hijack the victim's click actions and possibly launch further attacks against the victim. IBM X-Force ID: 245891.

item.title: CVE-2023-28517|2024-08-02T13:43:22.600Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.1.2, 6.2.0, and 6.2.2 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 250421.

item.title: CVE-2022-35640|2024-07-22T14:36:41.814Z -- ibm -- sterling%20partner%20engagement%20manager
item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.2.2 could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information when a detailed technical error message is returned. IBM X-Force ID: 230933.

item.description: IBM Sterling Partner Engagement Manager 6.1.2, 6.2.0, and 6.2.2 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 250421.
